commitResults.messageTitle: feat(person): add Student/Parent subclasses and Type ('s'|'p'); wire into add/edit
commitResults.messageBody:
- introduce Type value object (validates only 's' or 'p', case-insensitive)
- add Student and Parent subclasses; hard-code Type in constructors
- require Type in Person; expose getType()
- AddCommandParser: parse t/<type> and instantiate Student or Parent
- ParserUtil: add parseType()
- EditCommand/AddCommand: updated to handle Type field
- app runs; some test cases not updated yet (follow-up commit will align tests)

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: add cost per lesson field for students/parents
commitResults.messageBody:
Tutors and admins can now record each student's cost per lesson in SGD.
This makes payment tracking easier for both students and parents.

Currently, lesson details do not include payment information, making it
hard to view or update lesson costs.

Let's add a  field to the Add Student command to capture cost per
lesson as a float value (e.g. pay/72.5). This ensures consistency and
prevents invalid or duplicate entries.
Feature: add cost per lesson field for students/parents
add edit pay logic
feat(person): add Student/Parent subclasses and Type ('s'|'p'); wire …

commitResults.messageTitle: Add payment tracking command for student contacts
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no way to mark whether a student's payment has been received,
which makes it harder for tutors to track outstanding fees.

Let's add a  and  command to toggle payment status on
existing contacts. This includes validation, error handling, and GUI
updates to display a tick box when payment is confirmed.
Add Schedule command to Student

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor payment command to toggle status using student index
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the  command required a student name and always set
payment status to “paid”. This limited flexibility and created
redundancy when toggling between paid and unpaid states.

Let's update the command to:
* accept student index instead of name
* toggle payment status between paid and unpaid
* simplify command usage and reduce user errors

This change streamlines payment tracking, improves UX, and aligns the
command with the index-based design used across other commands.
Add linking and unlinking feature

- Added Student and Parent classes extending Person.

- Adjusted imports for Name, Phone, Email, and Address under seedu.address.model.person.
- Fixed Person.toString() to match PersonTest expectations.
- All tests passing and build successful.
